message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CL 

The paper proposes a method for improving the performance of deep neural networks in the presence of biased training data, which is a common problem in machine learning. The method involves learning an explicit weighting function directly from data, which can be used to adjust the importance of different training samples. This is a topic that is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), computer vision (cs.CV), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), neural networks (cs.NE), and natural language processing (cs.CL). However, given that the paper focuses on image classification tasks, cs.CV is the most likely sub-category, followed by cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, and cs.CL.
